required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Combined Endophthalmitis and Orbital Cellulitis in Patients With Novel Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19)
clinical_study.official_title: Combined Endophthalmitis and Orbital Cellulitis in Patients With Novel Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19)

brief_summary.textblock: To report on cases presented with combined endophthalmitis and orbital cellulitis as a first presentation of covid-19 infection.

detailed_description.textblock: This observation case series study included 5 patients referred to the Ophthalmology Department, Minia University with severe ophthalmic manifestations in the form of combined endophthalmitis and orbital cellulitis. On doing the work-up of covid-19 infection according to the recommendations of Egyptian Ministry of Health, patients proved to be infected by the novel Corona virus. In addition to the Corona work-up, all patients were subjected to full ophthalmological evaluation, ocular ultrasound and orbital CT examination.

primary_outcome.measure: Combined Endophthalmitis and Orbital Cellulitis in patients with Novel Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19)
primary_outcome.description: highlight the occurrence of combined endophthalmitis and orbital cellulitis in patients with novel Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19)

study_pop.textblock: 5 patients referred to the Ophthalmology Department, Minia University with severe ophthalmic manifestations in the form of combined endophthalmitis and orbital cellulitis. On doing the work-up of covid-19 infection according to the recommendations of Egyptian Ministry of Health, patients proved to be infected by the novel Corona virus.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with endophthalmitis and orbital cellulitis with covid-19
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients without endophthalmitis and orbital cellulitis.
- Patients with endophthalmitis and orbital cellulitis not having covid-19 infection.

reference.citation: Chen L, Liu M, Zhang Z, Qiao K, Huang T, Chen M, Xin N, Huang Z, Liu L, Zhang G, Wang J. Ocular manifestations of a hospitalised patient with confirmed 2019 novel coronavirus disease. Br J Ophthalmol. 2020 Jun;104(6):748-751. doi: 10.1136/bjophthalmol-2020-316304. Epub 2020 Apr 7.
